title.narrative: 5.3 VULNERABLE CHILDREN PRACTICE KEY HYGIENE BEHAVIOURS AND WATER CONSERVATION

description.narrative: Vulnerable children practice key hygiene behaviors and water conservation., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable people have access to safe drinking water, clean environment, and key hygiene/water conservation practices.

sector.narrative: Data/ research / evaluation / evidence generation / synthesis and use on climate, environment, disasters, energy and/or multi-thematic areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable children practice key hygiene behaviors and water conservation.

description.narrative: Recognizing that improved hygiene practices are a contributory factor to ensuring that children and their families can enjoy a healthy and dignified life, UNICEF continued to support the dissemination of messages on key hygiene practices reaching the most vulnerable. With national concern rising regarding water shortages across the country, UNICEF scaled up advocacy efforts with government counterparts, highlighting the importance of the conservation of water resources in anticipation of expected shortages, by focusing on behaviour change for longer term impact such as water saving and conservation practices, through community involvement and engagement of women, youth, and children. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/12/2021

title.narrative: % increase of target vulnerable children who demonstrate an awareness of key hygiene messages and water conservation(55392), Text

baseline.value: 40% of children correctly name three water conservation practices; 70% of children correctly name three diarrhoea prevention methods
